title: Patient Intake Form Generator
prompt:
Design a patient intake form for a [SPECIALTY] clinic.

Sections:
1. Demographics
2. Chief Complaint (Why are you here?)
3. History of Present Illness
4. Past Medical History
5. Medications & Allergies
6. Family History
7. Social History (Lifestyle)
8. Review of Systems

Ensure clear, patient-friendly language.

title: Symptom Checker Logic (Triage)
description: Basic triage logic for chatbots (Non-medical advice)
prompt:
Create a triage logic flow for [SYMPTOM, e.g., Headache].

Disclaimer: "I am an AI, not a doctor. Call 911 for emergencies."

Red Flags (Go to ER):
- Sudden onset "thunderclap"
- With fever/stiff neck
- Post-trauma

Yellow Flags (See Doctor soon):
- Worsening over days
- Not responding to OTC meds

Green Flags (Self-care):
- Tension type
- Hydration/Rest advice

title: Appointment Reminder Templates
description: Reduce no-shows with effective SMS/Email reminders
prompt:
Write a 3-part appointment reminder sequence.

Context: [Doctor/Dentist/Therapy]

1. Confirmation (Immediately upon booking): Date, time, location, cancellation policy.
2. Reminder (48 hours before): "Confirm your slot" link.
3. Day-of (2 hours before): Directions/Parking info.

Tone: Professional, clear, helpful.

title: Post-Op Care Instructions
prompt:
Write discharge instructions for [PROCEDURE].

Audience: Patient (Grade 5 reading level).

Sections:
1. What to expect (Normal pain/swelling)
2. Wound care (Cleaning/Dressing)
3. Medications (When/How to take)
4. Activity restrictions (Lifting/Driving)
5. Diet
6. When to call the doctor (Warning signs)

title: Insurance Appeal Letter
description: Fight claim denials with professional appeals
prompt:
Write a letter appealing a denied insurance claim.

Patient: [NAME]
Procedure: [PROCEDURE]
Reason for Denial: [Not medically necessary/Out of network]

Argument:
- Cite medical necessity (attach records)
- Reference standard of care guidelines
- Request peer-to-peer review

Tone: Formal, firm, evidence-based.

title: Medical Scribe Template
prompt:
Create a SOAP note template for [CONDITION].

S (Subjective): Patient quotes, history.
O (Objective): Vitals, physical exam findings.
A (Assessment): Diagnosis/Differential.
P (Plan): Meds, labs, referrals, follow-up.

Include common phrases/abbreviations for this condition.

title: Wellness Newsletter Content
prompt:
Write a monthly wellness newsletter for a clinic.

Theme: [Month/Season, e.g., Flu Season/Heart Health Month]

Content:
1. Health Tip of the Month
2. Myth vs Fact
3. Clinic News (New staff/hours)
4. Recipe or Exercise tip
5. CTA (Book check-up)

Tone: Encouraging, educational.
